page.title: 17TONMAWR - SOCIAL TENSIONS
page.content: A degree of tension exists between the two communities that make up the village: when the community centre was first proposed about 5 or 6 years ago, each community insisted that it should belong to that particular community in name and location, if nothng else. To get everyone's support for the scheme the organisers hit on a neutral name 'PELENNA' - named after the river, and a location near the school, \ way between the two communities. Jealousies were rekindled however, when Prince Charles opened the Centre. Quarrels caused during the debate about who should meet the Prince still smoulder on. Signs that the two communities are beginning to work better together can be seen in groups like the school's PTA and in the groups organising summer play schemes for children.
